H6981.def: = type of partridge, of which there were at least three variaties in ancient Israel;  it lives in small flocks called coveys, lays a great many eggs, and prefers to run when in danger, flying only when necessary; even when it takes flight it flies for only a short distance before dropping back to the ground; habitat differs from one kind of partridge to another; the rock partridge is about 35 centimeters (14 inches) in length and has striking white cheeks with a black band running from its brow, through its eyes, down its neck, and curving around its breast; It also has striking black and chestnut stripes on its flanks; its back and wings are gray; the beak and legs are red; both sexes look alike; the black francolin is about the same size but has a slightly shorter tail; the male has a black breast and flanks; the female is a speckled brown; the sand partridge is the color of the local sand and is about half the size of the other two types; ◄ Alectoris graeca, Alectoris chukar, Francolinus francolinus, Ammoperdix heyi; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H74.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ner<SDBH:נֵר>}; tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► army commander of king {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>} and his son {L:Ish-Bosheth<SDBH:אִישׁ־בֹּשֶׁת>}; father of {L:Jaasiel<SDBH:יַעֲשִׂיאֵל>}, officer in charge of his tribe, time of king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H5369.def: = small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>} and with a {L:wick<SDBH:פִּשְׁתָּה>} placed in it; sometimes placed on a {L:lampstand<SDBH:מְנֹורָה>}; used as a source of {L:light<SDBH:אֹור>}; ≈ associated with peace, stability and well-being

H3097.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Zeruiah<SDBH:צְרוּיָה>}, sister of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; ► chief of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}'s army

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H8019.def: = woman; ◄ daughter of {L:Dibri<SDBH:דִּבְרִי>}, tribe of {L:Dan<SDBH:דָּן>}; ► married an {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} man and had a son who was later stoned for blaspheming

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H3325.def: = descendant of {L:Izhar<SDBH:יִצְהָר>}; ◄ subclan of {L:Kohathites<SDBH:קְהָתִי>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}

H3663.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► chief of Levites during time of king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H2435.def: = relational referring to the part of an object that is located relatively far from the center or inside of that object; often used in opposition to the center part

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H7860.def: = person selected from among a group of people to assume a position of leadership and responsibility

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H2276.def: = descendant of {L:Hebron<SDBH:חֶבְרֹון>}; ◄ subclan of {L:Kohathites<SDBH:קְהָתִי>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H4628.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H3383.def: = river; ◄ flowing from Mount {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>} in a southerly direction through the {L:Sea of Galilee<SDBH:כִּנֶּרֶת>} into the {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H2276.def: = descendant of {L:Hebron<SDBH:חֶבְרֹון>}; ◄ subclan of {L:Kohathites<SDBH:קְהָתִי>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8435.def: = the relative order in which children of the same father were born

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H705.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H4438.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3270.def: = town; ◄ located in {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}, territory of {L:Gad<SDBH:גָּד>}; ► former {L:Amorite<SDBH:אֱמֹרִי>} territory; assigned to clan of {L:Merari<SDBH:מְרָרִי>}, tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; later occupied by {L:Moab<SDBH:מֹואָב>}

H1568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Makir<SDBH:מָכִיר>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► settler of the area on the east side of the {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H2677.def: = one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
